repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
TOhtml doesn't support treesitter, extmarks, or any other neovim-specific decorations. So let's rewrite it in lua. The TODO list; decorations: - [x] treesitter - [x] extmarks highlighting - [x] extmarks virtual text (except for `virt_text_pos=right_align`; and doesn't respect `hl_mode`) - [x] matchadd - [ ] spell - [ ] priority - [ ] LSP semantic tokens (help requested, see comment near `M.styletable_extmarks`) The TODO list; features from `TOhtml.vim`: - [x] syntax - [x] title - [x] folding (excluding highlighted folds) - [x] cterm colors - [x] conceal - [x] line number (neovim: statuscolumn) (sings) - [ ] fonts (neovim: guifont) - [ ] diffs - [ ] listchars - [x] progress bar - [x] support IE(internet explorer) - [x] non UTF8-encodings - [x] link URL (or URI) links (maybe later) - [ ] (other features that I have forgotten to put here)
TOhtml.vim settings - [x] ignore_conceal - [x] ignore_folding - [x] number_lines - [x] expand_tabs - [x] no_modeline - [x] pre_wrap - [ ] whole_filler - [ ] diff_one_file - [ ] font - [x] no_foldcolumn (`:set foldcolumn=0`) - [x] no_pre - [x] use_css - [x] use_xhtml - [x] no_links - [x] no_progress - [x] charset_override - [x] encoding_override - [x] no_doc - [x] no_invalid - [x] prevent_copy - [x] use_encoding - [x] use_input_for_pc - [x] line_ids (maybe later) - [x] id_expr (maybe later) - [x] hover_unfold (maybe later) - [x] dynamic_folds (maybe later)
The TODO list; others: - [ ] Move the functions to the right files - [ ] Add `syntax/2html.vim` which will run `TOhtml.lua` - [ ] Rename functions/types for better names - [ ] Add tests (How should this be done?) - [ ] Rewrite documentation Related: + https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/21629

comment_data.body: I think it's end_row + 1 here. Treesitter range is end-exclusive
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,473 @@
+--- Neovim plugin for converting a syntax highlighted file to HTML.
+
+if vim.g.loaded_2html_plugin then
+  return
+end
+vim.g.loaded_2html_plugin = 'nvim10.0_v1'
+
+---@class tohtml.state
+---@field bufnr number
+---@field background string
+---@field foreground string
+---@field title string|false
+---@field start_row number
+---@field end_row number
+---@field use_css boolean
+---@field font string
+---@class tohtml.opt
+---@field title? string|false
+---@field start_row? number
+---@field end_row? number
+---@field use_css? boolean
+---@class tohtml.styletable
+---@field highlights table<number,tohtml.highlight>
+---@field [number] tohtml.line
+---@class tohtml.line
+---@field [number] tohtml.cell?
+---@class tohtml.cell
+---@field [1]   number[] start
+---@field [2]   number[] close
+---@field [3] string[][] virt_text
+---@field [4]   number[] hide
+---@class tohtml.highlight
+---@field bold? boolean
+---@field italic? boolean
+---@field underline? boolean
+---@field color? {fg:string?,bg:string?}
+---@field name? string
+
+local M = {}
+---@param tbl table<''|any,nil|any>
+---@return table<''|any,any>
+function M.trim(tbl)
+  for k, v in pairs(tbl) do
+    if v == '' then
+      tbl[k] = nil
+    end
+  end
+  return tbl
+end
+---@generic T
+---@param tbl table<T,table|nil>
+---@param key T
+---@return table
+function M.fill(tbl, key)
+  if tbl[key] == nil then
+    tbl[key] = { {}, {}, {}, {} }
+  end
+  return tbl[key]
+end
+---@param state tohtml.state
+---@return tohtml.styletable
+function M.generate_styletable(state)
+  ---@type tohtml.styletable
+  local styletable = { highlights = {} }
+  for row = 1, state.end_row + 1 do
+    styletable[row] = {}
+  end
+  return styletable
+end
+---@param styletable tohtml.styletable
+---@param id number
+---@param state tohtml.state
+function M.extend_highlight(styletable, id, state)
+  if styletable.highlights[id] then
+    return
+  end
+  if not state.use_css then
+    styletable.highlights[id] = M.trim({
+      color = M.trim({
+        fg = vim.fn.synIDattr(id, 'fg#'),
+        bg = vim.fn.synIDattr(id, 'bg#'),
+      }),
+      underline = vim.fn.synIDattr(id, 'underline'),
+      bold = vim.fn.synIDattr(id, 'bold'),
+      italic = vim.fn.synIDattr(id, 'italic'),
+    })
+  else
+    styletable.highlights[id] = {
+      name = vim.fn.synIDattr(id, 'name'),
+    }
+  end
+end
+---@param styletable tohtml.styletable
+---@param state tohtml.state
+function M.styletable_syntax(styletable, state)
+  local bufnr = state.bufnr
+  vim.api.nvim_buf_call(bufnr, function()
+    local start_row = state.start_row
+    for row_offset, line in ipairs(styletable) do
+      row_offset = row_offset - 1
+      local prev_id = 0
+      for col = 1, #line - 1 do
+        local id = vim.fn.synID(start_row + row_offset, col, 1)
+        id = vim.fn.synIDtrans(id)
+        if id ~= prev_id then
+          if prev_id ~= 0 then
+            table.insert(line[col][2], prev_id)
+          end
+          prev_id = id
+          if id ~= 0 then
+            M.extend_highlight(styletable, id, state)
+            table.insert(M.fill(line, col)[1], id)
+          end
+        end
+      end
+      if prev_id ~= 0 then
+        table.insert(M.fill(line, #line)[2], prev_id)
+      end
+    end
+  end)
+end
+---@param styletable tohtml.styletable
+---@param state tohtml.state
+function M.styletable_treesitter(styletable, state)
+  ---TODO(altermo) get highlighted of injected trees after, which have not been on screen
+  local bufnr = state.bufnr
+  ---@diagnostic disable-next-line: undefined-field
+  local buf_highlighter = vim.treesitter.highlighter.active[bufnr]
+  if not buf_highlighter then
+    return
+  end
+  local start_row = state.start_row - 1
+  local end_row = state.end_row - 1
+  buf_highlighter.tree:for_each_tree(function(tstree, tree)
+    ---@cast tree LanguageTree
+    if not tstree then
+      return
+    end
+    local root = tstree:root()
+    local q = buf_highlighter:get_query(tree:lang())
+    ---@type Query?
+    local query = q:query()
+    if not query then
+      return
+    end
+    for capture, node, metadata in
+      query:iter_captures(root, buf_highlighter.bufnr, start_row, end_row)

comment_data.body: Seconding @lucario387's comment, it should be clear whether this is zero-based and/or past-to-end convention. See #26631
comment_data.diff_hunk:

+---@field bufnr number
+---@field background string
+---@field foreground string
+---@field title string|false
+---@field start_row number
+---@field end_row number

comment_data.body:
```suggestion

---@generic T
```
etc. Please use whitespaces and blank lines appropriately everywhere. I know it's a nit comment that is *unfair* for a draft PR, but commenting this early because these aren't enforced by Stylua.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

comment_data.body: Do we use this pattern in Lua plugins? Most of the code should live in a module that is not loaded until `require()`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,770 @@
+--- Neovim plugin for converting a syntax highlighted file to HTML.
+
+if vim.g.loaded_2html_plugin then

comment_data.body: Yeah, but I have it this way for ease of convenience. I'll move the functions to the right files when I'm done with the features.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,770 @@
+--- Neovim plugin for converting a syntax highlighted file to HTML.
+
+if vim.g.loaded_2html_plugin then

comment_data.body: Should live somewhere in `/lua` (which is the "`autoload` at home" for Lua functions).  There's really no need for this to be in `/plugin` and sourced on every startup).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,770 @@
+--- Neovim plugin for converting a syntax highlighted file to HTML.
+
+if vim.g.loaded_2html_plugin then

comment_regular_data.body: What about features such as a progress bar and linking URLs (and interactive folding)?
I think it's OK to keep the syntax file (and even preferable; makes syncing with Vim runtime slightly easier).

title: feat: rewrite TOhtml in lua
